en: He called me a coward.
He hit me back.
He went so far as to say that I was coward.
He pushed past me.
He made a promise to take me to the movies.
He accommodated me with a night's lodging.
He put me up for a night.
He let me stay for a night.
It is likely that he kept me waiting on purpose.
zh: 他很有可能是故意让我等的。

en: I wonder if he loves me.
zh: 我在想他到底喜不喜欢我。

en: He came to see me in a different light.
He came to see me in a different way.
zh: 他看我的眼光不一样了。

en: He thrust me aside.
He insulted me by calling me a donkey.
He often takes me for a drive.
He treats me as if I am a stranger.
zh: 他把我当成陌生人一样。

en: He treats me as if I were a stranger.
zh: 他把我当成陌生人一样。

en: He praised me to the skies.
He dropped in on me.
He calls me Pete.
He stared at me.
He nudged me to go ahead.
zh: 他推了推我，让我走前面。

en: He relaxed his hold on me.
He just glanced at me.
He beguiled me into accepting it.
He made me go there.
He introduced me to Sue.
He looked me over from head to foot.
zh: 他从头到脚打量了我一遍。

en: He stared at me and said nothing.
He fastened his eyes on me.
He fixed his eyes on me.
He accused me of being a liar.
He went so far as to call me a liar.
He took me for an Englishman.
He mistook me for an Englishman.
zh: 他把我误认成了英国人。

en: He kept me waiting for more than an hour.
zh: 他让我等了一个多小时。

en: He scolded me for being lazy.
He took me for my mother.
He mistook me for my mother.
He is stronger than I am.
He is cleverer than I.
He is more clever than me.
He is more clever than I am.
He's younger than me.
He is taller than me by a head.
He is a head taller than me.
He is taller than I.
He's taller than me.
He is able to run faster than I.
He can run faster than I.
He can run faster than I can.
He runs faster than I.
He walked before me.
He walked in front of me.
He speaks English better than I do.
He is a little bit more careful than I.
He is senior to me by three years.
He's three years older than I am.
He is younger than me by three years.
He is better able to teach than I am.
He is superior in learning to me.
He is a better swimmer than I.
He swims better than I do.
He is immediately above me in rank.
zh: 他的职位正好在我上面。

en: He can speak English much more fluently than I can.
zh: 他英语说得比我流利多了。

en: He put the shot farther than I did.
He is a better speaker of English than I.
He has more books than I do.
He is older than I by two years.
He is two inches taller than I am.
He is taller than I by two inches.
He is six years older than I.
He is my junior by three years.
He is three years senior to me.
He's three years older than my father.
He is junior to me by two years.
He is two years my junior.
He's two years younger than me.
He outweighs me by 10 kg.
He is less intelligent than me.
He does not run as fast as I.
He said, "I want to be a scientist."
He called out not only to me but also to my dog.
zh: 他不仅叫了我，还叫了我的狗。

en: He took me by the arm.
He took me by the arm and looked me in the eye.
zh: 他拉住我的胳膊，盯着我的眼睛。

en: He took hold of my arm and never let me loose.
zh: 他抓着我的胳膊，死活不撒手。

en: He caught me by the arm.
He has distorted my speech.
He was floored by my argument.
He is one of my neighbours.
He is one of my neighbors.
He is my next-door neighbor.
He lives next to me.
He seated himself next to me.
He gave a good impression to my parents.
zh: 他给我父母留下了好印象。

en: He came to see me during my absence.
zh: 我不在的时候他来看我了。

en: He is my Mr Right.
He's my Mr. Right.
He said nothing as to my request.
He turned a deaf ear to my request.
zh: 他对我的请求充耳不闻。

en: He robbed me of every penny I had.
zh: 他把我身上最后一分钱都给抢了。

en: He is my friend.
He's my friend.
He is included among my friends.
He looked me straight in the eyes.
zh: 他直勾勾地盯着我的眼睛。

en: He looked me in the eye.
He tried in vain to pull the wool over my eyes.
He hit me in the eye.
I owe him a great deal because he saved my life.
zh: 他救了我的命，我欠他个大人情。

en: I owe him my life.
He called my name.
He was making sheep's eyes at my daughter.
zh: 他老对我女儿暗送秋波。

en: He seemed surprised by my ignorance.
zh: 见我啥都不懂，他好像挺惊讶的。

en: He is no friend of mine.
He deprived my little sister of all her toys.
zh: 他把我妹妹的玩具全都抢走了。

en: He is engaged to my younger sister.
He is engaged to my sister.
He searched my face for my real intentions.
zh: 他盯着我的脸，想看出我的真实意图。

en: He is a man after my own heart.
He squashed my hat flat.
zh: 他把我的帽子给压扁了。

en: He asked after my mother.
He did not accept my apologies.
He works under me.
He came into my room.
He came up to my room.
He entered my room.
He made a pretense of knowing my father.
He is as tall as my father.
He is as old as my father.
He is not my father but my uncle.
He is my father.
He's my father.
He's my dad.
He made little of my complaints.
zh: 他根本没把我的抱怨当回事。

en: He cured my illness.
He slammed the door right in my face.
zh: 他当着我的面把门砰地关上了。

en: He brushed off my objections.
zh: 他对我反对意见不屑一顾。

en: He disclosed my secret.
He ate twice as much as I did.
He had twice as much money as I.
He earns double my salary.
He earns twice my salary.
He took advantage of my youth.
He is earning twice my salary.
zh: 他现在的工资是我的两倍。

en: I thought he was my special friend.
zh: 我原以为他是我最好的朋友。

en: He took me up on my remarks about equal rights.
zh: 他就我关于权利平等的言论跟我较起真来。

en: He mocked my efforts.
He sent an immediate reply to my telegram.
He turned up his nose at my suggestion.
zh: 他对我的建议嗤之以鼻。

en: He wouldn't look at my proposal.
He acceded to my proposal.
He didn't agree to my proposal.
He brought forward a strong objection to my proposal.
zh: 他对我的提议提出了强烈反对。

en: He is a close friend of my brother.
He interpreted for me.
He disputed my statement.
He stood godfather to my first son.
He made reference to my book.
He took no notice of my advice.
He would not listen to my advice.
He regretted not having taken my advice.
He won't look at my advice.
He paid no attention to my advice.
zh: 他压根儿没理会我的建议。

en: He yielded to my advice.
He would not follow my advice.
He wouldn't listen to my advice.
He shut his ears to my advice.
zh: 他对我的建议充耳不闻。

en: He is the only person that I known who is equal to the task.
zh: 他是我认识的人里唯一能胜任这项工作的。

en: He went there instead of me.
He ran a serious risk on my behalf.
zh: 他为了我冒了很大的风险。

en: He bears a strong likeness to my son.
He explained to my son why it rains.
zh: 他给我儿子讲了为什么会下雨。

en: He is not my son, but my nephew.
zh: 他不是我儿子，是我侄子。

en: He sat down by my side.
He sat down next to me.
He walked ahead of me.
He is running ahead of me.
He sat in front of me.
He is my teacher.
He looked satisfied with my explanation.
zh: 他对我的解释看起来很满意。

en: He seems satisfied with my explanation.
zh: 他好像对我的解释挺满意的。

en: He is my only living relative.
He made believe that he had not heard me.
He was jealous of my success.
He congratulated me on my success.
He envied my success.
He has changed my life.
He is one of my best friends.
zh: 他是我最好的朋友之一。

en: He is no relation to me.
He was my dear friend.
He was just behind me.
He sat right in front of me.
He as good as accepted my offer.
zh: 他基本上算是接受了我的提议。

en: He turned down my offer.
He rejected my offer flatly.
zh: 他断然拒绝了我的提议。

en: He admired my new car.
He robbed me of my new watch.
He asked me about my new job.
zh: 他问了我新工作的事儿。

en: He betrayed my confidence in him.
zh: 他辜负了我对他的信任。

en: He abused my confidence.
zh: 他滥用了我对他的信任。

en: He was amused at my joke.
He is my boss.
He is my rival in business.
He lives above me.
He was made my servant.
He asked for my advice.
He acted on my advice.
He gave witness to the truth of my statement.
zh: 他证明了我说的都是真的。

en: He is my uncle.
He isn't my cousin.
He caught me by the neck.
He seized me by the neck.
zh: 他一把抓住了我的脖子。

en: He showed a great reluctance to help me.
zh: 他表现得很不情愿帮我。

en: He seized me by the wrist.
He didn't reply to my letter.
He hasn't answered my letter yet.
He responded very quickly to my letter.
He wrote a prompt answer to my letter.
He caught me by the hand.
He took me by the hand.
He caught my hand and pulled me to the second floor.
zh: 他抓住我的手，把我拽到了二楼。

en: He caught hold of my hand.
He gave my hand a firm clasp.
zh: 他有力地握了握我的手。

en: He is my boss's friend and confidant.
zh: 他是我老板的朋友和心腹。

en: He will never forgive my debt.
zh: 他永远不会免除我的债务。

en: He didn't respond to my question.
He didn't answer my question.
He nodded in response to my question.
zh: 他点头回答了我的问题。

en: He gave a positive answer to my question.
zh: 他给了我一个肯定的回答。

en: He answered my question easily.
zh: 他很轻松地回答了我的问题。

en: He answered my question in the negative.
zh: 他给了我一个否定的回答。

en: He answered my question with a "no."
zh: 他用“不”回答了我的问题。

en: He was sitting there, delighted with my failure.
zh: 他坐在那儿，对我的失败幸灾乐祸。

en: He forgot to give back my dictionary.
He whispered the answer in my ear.
zh: 他在我耳边小声说了答案。

en: He simply shrugged off my suggestion.
zh: 他根本没把我的建议当回事。

en: He repaired my watch for me.
He came to my office yesterday.
He took me for my twin brother.
zh: 他把我当成了我的双胞胎兄弟。

en: He mistook me for my twin brother.
zh: 他把我错认成了我的双胞胎兄弟。

en: He has really made a hole in my finances.
zh: 他真的让我花了大笔钱。

en: He married my sister.
He is my working mate.
He is my colleague.
He assisted me with my business.
He hindered me in my work.
He often stands in the way of my work.
He mended my umbrella.
He has three times as many books as I have.
He earns three times as much as I.
He earns three times as much as I do.
He earns three times more than I do.
He earns three times more than me.
He robbed me of my purse.
He is acquainted with my wife.
He is my wife's acquaintance.
zh: 他是我老婆的一个熟人。

en: He is getting far too familiar with my wife.
zh: 他跟我老婆走得太近了。

en: He is my closest friend; we are like brothers.
zh: 他是我最好的朋友，我们就像亲兄弟一样。

en: He's my best friend. It's as if he were my brother.
zh: 他是我最好的朋友，就跟亲兄弟似的。

en: He's my best friend. We're like brothers.
zh: 他是我铁哥们儿，我们俩跟亲兄弟一样。

en: He blocked my way.
He accepted my idea.
He is envious of my good fortune.
He overlooked my mistake.
He stood behind me.
He is my old friend.
He doesn't speak my language.
He turned a deaf ear to my words.
He took offense at what I said and turned on his heels.
zh: 他因为我说的话生气了，扭头就走。

en: He made believe that he did not hear me.
He believes whatever I say.
He turned a deaf ear to me.
He turns a deaf ear to me.
He will not listen to me.
He made believe not to hear me.
He ran through my manuscript.
zh: 他匆匆翻了一下我的稿子。

en: He quickly scanned my manuscript.
zh: 他飞快地扫了一眼我的稿子。

en: He proofread my manuscript.
He made a speech in support of my view.
zh: 他发言支持了我的观点。

en: He tapped me on the shoulder.
He dealt me a blow on the shoulder.
zh: 他朝我肩膀上打了一拳。

en: He advised me on my study.
zh: 他在学习上给了我一些建议。

en: He is bone of my bone, flesh of my flesh.
He paid attention to my warning.
He paid no attention to my warning.
He nodded to show that he approved of my plan.
zh: 他点头表示赞成我的计划。

en: He is junior to my brother by three years.
He looks older than my brother.
He's three years younger than my older brother.
He is not so old as my brother.
He's not as old as my brother.
He isn't as old as my brother.
He's a friend of my brother's.
He's like a brother to me.
zh: 他对我来说就像亲兄弟一样。

en: He is as tall as my brother.
He isn't my brother. He's my cousin.
He is my brother, not father.
He is my brother, not my father.
He gave a good shine to my shoes.
He stole the money from my safe.
zh: 他从我的保险箱里偷了钱。

en: He doesn't live in my neighborhood.
He dragged at my collar.
He saw the surprise on my face.
He grabbed me by the collar.
He asked my pardon.
He would not raise my salary.
He earns three times as much as me.
He is my classmate.
He seems to be aware of my feelings.
zh: 他好像察觉到了我的心意。

en: He flicked me in the face.
He looked at me for an explanation.
He struck me a blow on the face.
He looked me in the face.
He stared me straight in the face.
He gave me a blank stare.
He kissed me on the forehead.
He promised to see about my broken watch.
zh: 他答应帮我看看我那块坏了的手表。

en: He accused me of my mistake.
He sang the way I did.
He made a hit with my family.
He dropped in at my house.
He passed by my house but didn't drop in.
zh: 他路过我家却没进来坐坐。

en: He looked at all the beautiful things in my house.
zh: 他看了看我家里的那些漂亮玩意儿。

en: He lives six houses beyond my house.
zh: 他家离我家隔了六户人家。

en: He called at my house.
He lives far away from my house.
He kicked me in the side.
He sprawled out on the sofa next to me.
zh: 他瘫坐在我旁边的沙发上。

en: He is my distant relation.
He helped me to move.
He helped me move.
He is my best friend.
He has half again as many books as I.
He has half again as many books as I do.
He has agreed with me.
He agreed with me.
His opinion was the same as mine.
He listened to my opinion.
He is in sympathy with my opinion.
He agrees with my opinion.
He gave in to my views.
He acted as my guide.
He can't endure my selfishness any more.
zh: 他再也受不了我的自私了。

en: He looked over my report.
He is my good partner.
He is an old friend of mine.
He touched me on the cheek.
He accepted my present.
He found my bike.
He suggested a plan similar to mine.
zh: 他提出了一个和我的类似的计划。

en: He came to me hat in hand and asked for a loan.
zh: 他低三下气地来找我借钱。

en: He often dropped in on me.
He would often come to see me.
He isn't appreciative of my little jokes.
zh: 他并不怎么欣赏我的冷笑话。

en: He has done his utmost for me.
zh: 他为了我的事已经尽全力了。

en: He put in a good word for me.
He put himself to much trouble on my behalf.
zh: 他为了我的事费了不少心。

en: I wonder if he can reserve the flight for me.
zh: 我在想他能不能帮我订个机票。

en: He tried to put the blame on me.
zh: 他想把责任推到我身上。

en: He is a complete stranger to me.
He made me sing on the stage.
He followed hard after me.
He pulled my shirt.
He finds faults with everything I do.
zh: 他对我做的每件事都挑三拣四。

en: He finds fault with everything I do.
He recommended this dictionary to me.
zh: 他向我推荐了这本词典。

en: He scarcely seems to care for me, does he?
zh: 他好像一点都不在乎我，对吧？

en: He gave me a smile of recognition.
zh: 他认出我后冲我笑了笑。

en: He will not steal my money; I have faith in him.
zh: 他不会偷我钱的，我信得过他。

en: He is in my favor.
He took me by the collar.
He acknowledged my presence with a nod.
zh: 他冲我点点头，算是打过招呼了。

en: He noticed my presence.
He noticed I was there.
He got engaged to my cousin.
He married my cousin.
He's not my cousin.
He is the last man I want to see.
zh: 他是我最不想见到的人。

en: I have three times as many books as he.
I have three times as many books as he does.
zh: 我的书有他的三倍那么多。

en: He laughed off my idea.
zh: 他对我的想法付之一笑，没当回事。

en: He made as if to speak to me but said nothing.
zh: 他欲言又止，最后什么也没说。

en: He hurried past me without stopping to speak.
zh: 他匆忙从我身边走过，没停下来跟我打招呼。

en: He asked a favor of me.
He told me that he would visit Nara next month.
zh: 他跟我说他下个月要去奈良。

en: He told me he was planning to visit Nara next month.
zh: 他说他打算下个月去奈良。

en: He got me some vegetables.
He commanded me to shut the gate.
He gave me a wink.
He carved me a wooden doll.
zh: 他给我刻了个木头娃娃。

en: He is really putting the squeeze on me.
He made himself known to me.
He apologized to me for his rudeness.
zh: 他因为自己的无礼向我道了歉。

en: He made me sing.
He lent me a book, which was too difficult for me.
zh: 他借给我一本书，但对我来说太难了。

en: He lent me two books, neither of which I have read as yet.
zh: 他借给我的两本书，我一本还没看。

en: He lent me two books.
He asked me if I was busy.
He asked me whether I was busy.
He advised me to see a lawyer. This I did at once.
zh: 他建议我去找律师，我立马就去了。

en: He said he would write to me, but he hasn't.
zh: 他说会给我写信，但一直没写。

en: He left without saying good-bye to me.
zh: 他没跟我打招呼就走了。

en: He is angry with me.
He ordered me to sweep the room.
He let me leave the room.
He raised a weapon against me.
He smiled at me and got on the train.
zh: 他对我笑了笑，然后上了火车。

en: He told me a sad story.
zh: 他给我讲了一个悲伤的故事。

en: He suggested to me that I should take her there.
He asked me if I knew her telephone number.
zh: 他问我知不知道她的电话号码。

en: He advised me not to believe what she says.
zh: 他劝我别相信她说的话。

en: He told me that she was sick.
He told me his age, his birthplace, his family, and so on.
zh: 他告诉了他的年龄、出生地、家里的情况什么的。

en: He showed me his picture.
He showed me his album.
He gave me what money he had.
zh: 他把他所有的钱都给我了。

en: He begged me to stay.
He told me how to get to the museum.
zh: 他告诉了我去博物馆怎么走。

en: He asked me my age, my name, my address, and so forth.
zh: 他问了我的年龄、姓名、地址什么的。

en: He asked me two questions.
He told me to make sure of the date.
He told me that he had no time to read books.
zh: 他跟我说他没时间看书。

en: He assigned me three books to read.
zh: 他给我布置了三本书看。

en: He showered abuse on me.
He made a gesture to me to run away.
He advised me that he had arrived.
He let me know that he had arrived.
He keeps on phoning me, and I really don't want to talk to him.
zh: 他老是给我打电话，我真不想理他。

en: He took an unfriendly attitude toward me.
zh: 他对我的态度很不友好。

en: He told me a long story.
zh: 他跟我讲了一个很长的故事。

en: He came up with me.
He wrote me a long letter.
He gave me a piece of advice.
He sent me a brief note.
zh: 他给我传了个简短的便条。

en: He sent me a brief letter.
zh: 他给我写了一封简短的信。

en: He is very kind to me.
He asked me whether he should go on to university.
zh: 他问我他该不该继续上大学。

en: He told me not to wait for him.
He acted fairly toward me.
He is very friendly toward me.
He demanded a large sum of money from me.
He told me to leave the window open.
He instructed me to go to bed early.
He gave a nice present to me.
zh: 他送了我一份精美的礼物。

en: He told me that he had seen her there the day before.
zh: 他告诉我他前一天在那儿见过她。

en: He told me where to buy origami.
zh: 他告诉我哪儿能买到折纸。

en: He gave me some stamps.
He showed me his stamp collection.
zh: 他给我看了他的集邮册。

en: He kept a seat for me.
He told me to cut down the cost of its production.
He told me to be here at noon.
He asked me a question.
He asked me if I liked mathematics.
He showed kindness by giving me a piece of advice.
zh: 他人挺好，给了我个建议。

en: He gave me a piece of friendly advice.
zh: 他出于好意给了我个建议。

en: He did me a good turn.
He's kind to me.
He rang me up at midnight.
zh: 他半夜给我打了个电话。

en: He assigned me a new job.
zh: 他给我分派了个新活儿。

en: He made me a new suit.
zh: 他给我做了一套新西装。

en: He received me cordially.
He didn't allow me to pay the bill for the dinner.
He didn't give me anything to eat.
He told me all the details.
He asked me to renew the bond.
He gave me not less than five thousand yen.
zh: 他给了我至少五千日元。

en: He gave me money as well as advice.
zh: 他不仅给了我钱，还给了我建议。

en: He gave me not just advice, but money as well.
zh: 他不光给了我建议，还给了我钱。

en: He asked me for help.
He asked me to help him.
He handed a note to me.
He taught me how to write.
He made a sign to me to go out.
He sent me his congratulations by wire.
He telegraphed me his congratulations.
He offered to help me.
He denied having written to me.
He wrote me a letter.
He grabbed my hand.
He prostrated himself and begged my pardon.
He held out his hand to me.
He made motions at me with his hand.
He did not so much as apologize to me.
zh: 他甚至都没跟我道过歉。

en: He promised me the position of company president.
zh: 他答应让我当公司总裁。

en: He made a sign to me to keep off the grass.
He gave me an example.
He warned me that I would fail.
He begged me not to object to his plan.
zh: 他求我不要反对他的计划。

en: He promised that he would write to me once in a while.
zh: 他答应会偶尔给我写信。

en: He got me a watch.
He gave me a watch.
He blamed the accident on me.
zh: 他把事故怪到了我头上。

en: He gave me an outline of the affair.
zh: 他跟我说了下这件事的大概情况。

en: He taught me how to write a poem.
He brought me the news that our team had won.
zh: 他带给我我们队赢了的消息。

en: He convinced me that I was in the wrong.
zh: 他让我意识到是我错了。

en: He nodded to show that he agreed with me.
zh: 他点头表示同意我的看法。

en: He bore a grudge against me.
He told me that he was very tired then.
zh: 他跟我说他那会儿很累。

en: He promised me that he would be more careful in the future.
zh: 他答应我以后会更小心的。

en: He promised to pay us high wages.
He didn't give me time to think.
He assumed an aggressive attitude toward me.
He gave me back talk.
He showed me round the park.
He told me not to look behind.
He bade me stay behind.
He did as I told him.
He did what I told him to do.
He scrunched down in his seat so that I wouldn't see him.
zh: 他缩在座位里，免得被我看见。

en: He acquainted me with the change of the plan.
zh: 他跟我说了计划变了的事。

en: He told me about the change in the plan.
He informed me about the changes in the plan.
zh: 他通知了我计划的变动。

en: He is always bothering me to lend him money.
He said he would lend me money.
He bothered me for money.
He asked me for some money.
He told me not to smoke.
He asked for my pardon.
He showed me the way to the ballpark.
He ordered me to stand up.
He went by me without noticing me.
zh: 他从我身边经过，都没注意到我。

en: He acknowledged me by lifting his hat.
zh: 他举了举帽子跟我打招呼。

en: He told me to go home and I obeyed him.
zh: 他叫我回家，我就听了他的。

en: He warned me of the danger.
He asked me if I could do him a favor.
zh: 他问我能不能帮他个忙。

en: He gave me an explanation for his mistake.
zh: 他跟我解释了他犯的错。

en: He gave me a select brand of canned goods.
zh: 他给了我一些精选牌子的罐头。

en: He defied me to dive off the cliff.
zh: 他激我从悬崖上跳下去。

en: He told me that he wanted to leave the company.
He cut me dead.
He sent me a letter saying that he could not see me.
zh: 他给我写信说他见不了我。

en: He came to my house on the pretext of seeing me.
zh: 他借着看我的名义来我家。

en: He came to see me all the way from his hometown.
zh: 他大老远从老家赶来看我。

en: He came to see me.
He made me carry his baggage.
He presented me with a bouquet of flowers.
It's not his place to tell me what to do.
zh: 还没轮到他来教我怎么做。

en: He asked me what my name was.
He whispered something to me.
zh: 他凑在我耳边说了点什么。

en: He spared me some salt.
He gave me the salt.
He advised me not to smoke.
He assured me of his help.
He showed me the way to the station.
zh: 平衡点他给我指了去车站的路。

en: He taught me how to swim.
He lied to me. That is why I am angry with him.
zh: 他骗了我，所以我才生他的气。

en: He told me not to tell lies.
He lied to me.
He twisted my arm.
He pressured me.
He flung a stream of abuse at me.
He bears ill will against me.
He rose to his feet to greet me.
He sent me an affectionate letter.
zh: 他给我写了一封充满爱意的信。

en: He let me use his typewriter.
He explained the rule to me.
He gave me a record.
He wrote me a love letter.
He did well by me.
He used to tell me stories about India.
zh: 他以前常给我讲印度的故事。

en: He found me a good job.
He beckoned me nearer.
He told me that I should be more careful.
zh: 他跟我说我应该再小心点。

en: He told me to speak more slowly.
He encouraged me to try again.
He slipped me a note.
zh: 他悄悄塞给我一张纸条。

en: He told me that would come again.
zh: 他跟我说他还会再来的。

en: He told me that Poe's novels were interesting.
zh: 他跟我说爱伦·坡的小说挺有意思的。

en: He made me write the letter with a pen.
zh: 他让我用钢笔写这封信。

en: He sent me a present.
He gave me a present.
He gave me a hint.
He was rather shorter with me.
He did me a great wrong.
He was too clever for me and I was done brown.
zh: 他太精明了，我被他耍得团团转。

en: He answered not a word to me.
He gave me some bread, also some milk.
zh: 他给了我些面包，还有些牛奶。

en: He reminded me not to forget my passport.
zh: 他提醒我别忘了拿护照。

en: He suggested that I accompany him to the party.
zh: 他建议我陪他去参加派对。

en: He was silent for what seemed to me an hour.
zh: 他半天没吭声，我觉得就像过了一个小时。

en: He sewed a dress for me.
He is a good husband to me.
zh: 他对我来说是个好丈夫。

en: He is an ideal husband for me.
zh: 他是我心目中理想的丈夫。

en: He has been like a father to me.
He asked me which way to go.
He asked me to open the door.
He took back what he had said about me.
zh: 他收回了之前说的关于我的那些话。

en: He beckoned me to follow him.
He motioned for me to follow him.
He signaled that I should follow him.
He told me how to play chess.
He motioned me to stand up.
He called me a cab.
He called me a taxi.
He called a taxi for me.
He called a cab for me.
He found me a taxi.
He was most kind to me.
He requested me to keep it secret.
He told me to do it.
He gave it to me.
He explained the matter to me.
He enlightened me on how I should attack the subject.
zh: 他启发了我该如何处理这个课题。

en: He sold me the book for one thousand yen.
zh: 他一千日元把书卖给我了。

en: He told me that the book was interesting.
zh: 他跟我说那本书很有意思。

en: He advised me that I keep the secret.
He showed me the way to the store.
zh: 他给我指了去那家店的路。

en: He acquainted me with the news.
zh: 他把那个消息告诉我了。

en: He taught me how to spell the word.
zh: 他教了我那个单词怎么拼。

en: He said to me, 'I read this book yesterday'.
zh: 他跟我说：“我昨天读了这本书。”

en: He gave me precise instructions to do the job.
zh: 他详细地交代了我该怎么做那个工作。

en: He expected great success in the project from me.
zh: 他指望我能在这个项目上取得成功。

en: He gave me an account of the machine.
zh: 他跟我讲了讲那台机器的情况。

en: He bade me go there.
He promised me to pay back the money.
He commanded me to do it.
He did what he promised to do for me.
zh: 他答应我的事都做到了。

en: He struck at me with a stick.
He found me a nice tie.
zh: 他帮我找了条挺好看的领带。

en: He gave me a nice Christmas present.
zh: 他送了我一份很棒的圣诞礼物。

en: He bought me a nice camera.
zh: 他给我买了个挺好的相机。

en: He commanded me to leave the room immediately.
zh: 他命令我立刻离开房间。

en: He demanded that I should pay the money at once.
He made me a suit.
He did not so much as say good-by to me.
zh: 他甚至连句再见都没跟我说。

en: He left without so much as saying good-by to me.
zh: 他甚至没跟我说再见就走了。

en: He went out without saying goodbye to me.
He gave me this book.
He showed me how to make a cake.
He paid me a compliment.
He demanded that I should pay the money back at once.
zh: 他要求我立刻把钱还了。

en: He told me an interesting story.
zh: 他给我讲了一个有趣的故事。

en: He nodded to me.
He has done me many kindnesses.
He gave me some money.
He found me a good seat.
He showed me his photograph album.
He sent me some American magazines.
zh: 他给我寄了几本美国杂志。

en: He didn't give me much advice.
He told me not to drive too fast.
He mentioned your name to me.
He never sees me without complaining about his wife.
zh: 他每次见到我都要抱怨他老婆。

en: He gave me a vague answer.
He asked me to wake him at six.
He told me that he would go to France in June.
zh: 他跟我说他六月份要去法国。

en: He gave me no less than five thousand yen.
zh: 他足足给了我五千日元。

en: He asked a few questions of me.
He asked me a few questions.
He gave me 10,000 yen.
He ordered me to go alone.
He advanced me a week's wages.
zh: 他预支了一周的工资给我。

en: He told me a lot about Kyoto as he knew it ten years ago.
zh: 他跟我讲了很多他十年前见过的京都的样子。

en: He gave me no less than ten dollars.
He prayed that God would bless me.
He told me that I looked pale and asked me what the matter was.
zh: 他说我脸色不太好，问我怎么了。

en: He told me to run faster, and asked me if I was tired.
zh: 他让我跑快点，还问我累不累。

en: He said to me, "You look sad. What is the matter with you?"
zh: 他跟我说：“你看起来很难过，出什么事了吗？”

en: He asked me where she lived.
He asked me if I knew his father.
He asked me who had painted the picture.
zh: 他问我这幅画是谁画的。

en: He asked me who painted the picture.
zh: 他问我是谁画了这幅画。

en: He gave me what I needed.
zh: 他把我需要的都给我了。

en: He told me that he would wait till I returned.
zh: 他说他会等到我回来为止。

en: He asked me what I expected.
He asked me what I needed.
He telephoned me again and again.
zh: 他一遍又一遍地给我打电话。

en: He asked me what I had bought.
He asked me who that man was.
He explained to me how to use the machine.
zh: 他教了我这机器怎么用。

en: He said that he had seen the picture before.
zh: 他说他以前见过这幅画。

en: He explained to me that he had no money.
He told me that you were right.
He told me that he would leave before long.
zh: 他跟我说他过不了多久就要走了。

en: He is not young any more than I am.
He is not rich any more than I am.
He is no more a singer than I am.
zh: 他跟我一样，都不是唱歌的。

en: He uses the same dictionary as I do.
zh: 他用的词典跟我的一样。

en: He is as tall as I.
He is as old as I.
He has the same camera as I have.
He's a contemporary of mine.
He's the same age as I.
He's my age.
He is the same age as me.
He's the same age as me.
It seems that he took me for my sister.
zh: 他好像把我认成我姐了。

en: It seems that he mistook me for my sister.
zh: 他好像把我错当成我姐了。

en: He mistook me for my younger brother.
He gave me a firm hand grasp.
He was my business associate.
zh: 他以前是我的生意伙伴。

en: He shook hands with me.
He shared in my happiness.
He lost his temper with me.
He has coached us for half a year.
He doesn't know both of us.
zh: 他并不全认识我们两个。

en: He took us to the zoo.
He set us by the ears.
He brought us a small gift each time he called on us.
zh: 他每次来看我们都会带个小礼物。

en: He took us back in his car.
He led us to the station.
He knows us very well.
He kept us waiting for more than an hour.
zh: 他让我们等了一个多小时。

en: He makes it a point to remember each one of our birthdays.
zh: 他总是特意记住我们每个人的生日。

en: He is such a teacher as we all admire.
zh: 他是那种我们大家都非常敬佩的老师。

en: He rejected our demand flatly.
zh: 他一口拒绝了我们的要求。

en: He failed to get elected contrary to our expectation.
zh: 与我们的预期相反，他没能当选。

en: He left soon after our arrival.
He turned down our proposal.
He plays basketball best of us all.
zh: 他是我们当中打篮球打得最好的。

en: He is less strict than our teacher.
He is our teacher and a person we should respect.
zh: 他是我们的老师，也是一个值得我们尊敬的人。

en: He rejected our offer.
He failed to apologize for betraying our trust.
zh: 他背叛了我们的信任，却连个歉都没道。

en: He passed for a learned man in our community.
zh: 在我们社区，大家都觉得他是个有学问的人。

en: He is anxious for our happiness.
He offered ten dollars for our old radio.
zh: 他出价十块钱买我们的旧收音机。

en: He wouldn't believe us.
I think he will object to our plan.
zh: 我觉得他会反对我们的计划。

en: He raised our expectations only to disappoint us.
zh: 他让我们满怀期待，最后却让我们大失所望。

en: He is a teacher at our school.
zh: 他是我们学校的一名老师。

en: He broke in on our conversation.
zh: 他插话打断了我们的谈话。

en: He has no right to interfere in our family affairs.
zh: 他没权利插手我们的家务事。

en: He is our teacher of English.
He is our English teacher.
He is in charge of making arrangements for our trip to Europe.
zh: 他负责安排我们的欧洲之旅。

en: He interfered in our private concerns.
I think he will come to our party.
zh: 我想他会来参加我们的聚会。

en: It is possible that he will come to our party.
zh: 他有可能会来参加我们的聚会。

en: He knows neither of us.
He doesn't know any one of us.
zh: 我们当中的任何一个人他都不认识。

en: He lives immediately next to us.
He's going to join our club.
zh: 他打算加入我们的俱乐部。

en: He is in charge of our class.
He lectured our class on literature.
He is the fastest runner in our class.
zh: 他是我们班跑得最快的。

en: He is one of our most experienced chairmen.
zh: 他是我们最有经验的主席之一。

en: He bought us nice books.
zh: 他给我们买了一些很好的书。

en: He shouted to us to come.
zh: 他冲我们大喊，让我们过去。

en: He bade us farewell, and went away.
zh: 他跟我们道了别，然后就走了。

en: He got angry with us.
Hardworking people succeed in life.
zh: 勤奋的人在生活中会取得成功。

en: A man of industry will succeed in life.
He brought us sad news.
zh: 他给我们带来了一个不幸的消息。

en: He showed us his mother's picture.
zh: 他给我们看了他母亲的照片。

en: He showed us how to ride a horse.
He solicited our votes.
He gave us not only clothes but some money.
zh: 他不仅给了我们衣服，还给了我们一些钱。

en: He demanded that we should pay him.
He told us many lessons.
He dashed us with water.
He smiled at us and got on the train.
zh: 他冲我们笑了笑，然后上了火车。

en: He tried speaking French to us.
He gave us the signal to begin.
zh: 他给我们发了开始的信号。

en: He made a desk and two benches for us.
zh: 他给我们做了一张书桌和两条长凳。

en: He dropped in to see us.
He appealed to us for help.
He is a British teacher who teaches us English.
zh: 他是教我们英语的英国老师。

en: He commanded us to work hard.
zh: 他命令我们要努力工作。

en: He did not say a word to us.
zh: 他一句话也没跟我们说。

en: He got us nice seats.
zh: 他给我们弄到了不错的座位。

en: He wants to see us again.
He tried to speak French to us.
He was an entire stranger to us.
zh: 他对我们来说完全是个陌生人。

en: He asked us what we wanted.
He suggested to us that we should stay.
He is precious to us.
He ordered us steaks.
He made us do the work.
He gave us quite a lot of trouble.
zh: 他给我们添了不少麻烦。

en: He told us, "Set off at once."
He told us to depart at once.
He told us that we should leave right away.
zh: 他跟我们说我们应该马上离开。

en: He told us to set off at once.
He often tells us we must help one another.
zh: 他经常跟我们说要互相帮助。

en: He told us an interesting story.
zh: 他给我们讲了一个有趣的故事。

en: He gave us a false story.
zh: 他编了个假故事骗我们。

en: He lied to us.
He told us a lie.
He suggested to us that we should go.
He lives across the street from us.
He was to dine with us.
zh: 他原本要跟我们一起吃晚饭的。

en: He was to have dined with us, but he became seriously sick all of a sudden.
zh: 他本来要跟我们一起吃晚饭的，但他突然病得很重。

en: I insist that he should go with us.
zh: 我坚持要他跟我们一起去。

en: He went in the opposite direction from us.
zh: 他跟我们走的方向相反。

en: He has the least money of us all.
zh: 我们所有人里他的钱最少。

en: He accused us of wronging him.
He is pleased when we are bewildered.
zh: 看到我们困惑，他倒挺高兴。

en: He isn't the kind of person who we want to work with.
zh: 他不是那种我们想一起共事的人。

en: He said it didn't matter whether we stayed or left.
zh: 他说我们是留是走都无所谓。

en: He will assist us in changing the tire.
He will remember us saying so.
zh: 他会记得我们这么说过。

en: He proposed that we should start at once.
He is about my size.
He did the reverse of what I asked.
zh: 他做的跟我要求的正好相反。

en: He blamed me for not coming.
He was displeased with my coming.
zh: 他对我来这里很不高兴。

en: He put me in touch with the kidnappers.
zh: 他让我跟绑匪取得了联系。

en: He blamed me, saying I'd broken the promise.
zh: 他责怪我，说我没遵守诺言。

en: He forgave me breaking my promise.
zh: 他原谅了我没遵守诺言。

en: He doubts if I will keep my promise.
He doubts that I'll keep my promise.
He interpreted my silence as consent.
zh: 他把我的沉默当成了默认。

en: He is the only friend I can really trust.
zh: 他是我唯一能真正信任的朋友。

en: He had done his homework when I called on him.
zh: 我去找他的时候，他已经写完作业了。

en: He suggested that I write to her at once.
zh: 他建议我马上给她写信。

en: He works harder than I did at his age.
zh: 他比我当年像他那个岁数时还要努力。

en: He died previous to my arrival.
zh: 他在我赶到之前就去世了。

en: He died before I arrived.
zh: 在我到之前他就去世了。

en: He took it for granted that I knew the answer.
zh: 他想当然地以为我知道答案。

en: He attends the same school that I do.
zh: 他和我上的是同一所学校。

en: He responded to the signal I gave.
zh: 他对我给出的信号做出了反应。

en: He was at the point of death when I arrived.
zh: 我到的时候，他已经奄奄一息了。

en: Despite my warnings, he works no harder.
zh: 尽管我警告过他，他还是没多努力。

en: He wouldn't permit me to swim in the river.
He was the first actor I had met in my life.
zh: 他是我这辈子见到的第一个演员。

en: He is one of the rottenest fellows that have ever crossed my path.
zh: 他是我见过的人里最烂的一个。

en: He helped me carry the baggage.
He thought it foolish of me to go to Kyushu by bike.
zh: 他觉得我骑自行车去九州挺傻的。

en: He thought it foolish of me to go there by bike.
zh: 他觉得我骑自行车去那儿挺傻的。

en: He was delighted to know I had passed the exam.
zh: 听说我考试过了，他特别高兴。

en: He was as good a man as I had thought.
zh: 他这人确实和我之前想的一样好。

en: He isn't any older than I thought.
zh: 他并没我想象的那么老。

en: He was otherwise than I thought.
zh: 他和我原先想的不一样。

en: He wasn't the same as I thought he'd be.
zh: 他和我预想的不太一样。

en: He is not the man that he was when I first knew him.
zh: 他已经不再是当初我认识的那个他了。

en: He is the last man that I want to talk with.
zh: 他是我最不想说话的人。

en: He is the novelist whom I admire most.
zh: 他是我最崇拜的小说家。

en: He's the novelist I admire the most.
zh: 他是我最欣赏的小说家。

en: He's the last man that I want to see.
zh: 他是我最不想见到的人。

en: He went out of his way to help me when I was in trouble.
zh: 我有困难的时候，他特意跑来帮我。

en: He stood by me whenever I was in trouble.
zh: 每次我有麻烦，他总是支持我。

en: He ignores my problems.
zh: 他对我的问题不管不顾。

en: I wonder if he will stand by me when I am in trouble.
zh: 我在想，等我有困难的时候他会不会帮我。

en: He is the least capable man I have ever employed.
zh: 他是我雇过的最没本事的人。

en: He is the most obstinate child I have ever seen.
zh: 他是我见过的最犟的孩子。

en: He is the tallest man that I have ever seen.
zh: 他是我见过的最高的人。

en: He mentioned a book the title of which I can't remember now.
zh: 他提到了一本书，但书名我现在记不起来了。

en: He doesn't want me to go, but I mean to.
zh: 他不想让我去，但我非去不可。

en: He said that I must go.
He credits me with doing things I never thought of.
zh: 他觉得那些我从没想过的事都是我做的。

en: He believes that I can do things that I've never even thought of doing.
zh: 他相信我能做成那些我连想都没想过的事。

en: He repeated in public what I had said.
zh: 他在公开场合重复了我说的那些话。

en: He did it the way I told him to.
He was aware of my presence but he did not greet me.
zh: 他知道我在那儿，但没跟我打招呼。

en: He taxed me with neglect of duty.
He criticized me for neglecting my duty.
He objected to my smoking.
He suspects me of telling a lie.
He as good as called me a liar.
zh: 他那话的意思简直就是说我撒谎。

en: He lost a watch which I had bought him a week before.
zh: 他把我一个星期前给他买的一块表给弄丢了。

en: He lost the watch that I had bought him a week before.
zh: 他把我一个星期前给他买的那块表给弄丢了。

en: He helped me carry the chair.
He robbed me of every cent I had.
zh: 他抢走了我身上的每一分钱。

en: He was given a book by me.
He stole money from me.
He censured me for what I had done.
zh: 他因为我做的事指责了我。

en: He thinks it impossible for me to climb the mountain alone.
zh: 他觉得我一个人爬那座山是不可能的。

en: He thought me very tired.
He thought that I was very tired.
It was I who met him.
I'm the one who met him.
zh: 我就是见到他的那个人。

en: He came just as I was leaving.
zh: 我正要走的时候他正好来了。

en: He asked me if I had found it.
He kept playing the same record over and over until I had to leave the room.
zh: 他一直反复放同一张唱片，直到我不得不离开了房间。

en: He helped me to get over the difficulties.
He could not approve of my going there.
He said that I must go there.
He is the very man that I'm looking for.
zh: 他就是我要找的那个人。

en: The last time when I saw him, he was quite well.
zh: 上次我见到他的时候，他身体还挺好的。

en: He was not conscious of my presence here.
He thanked me for coming.
He could not find what I had hidden.
He seemed unconscious of my presence.
zh: 他好像没意识到我在这儿。

en: He was sentenced to death.
He was condemned to death.
He advocated abolishing the death penalty.
He committed suicide to atone for his sin.
I could not but think that he had died.
zh: 我不由得觉得他已经不在人世了。

en: They fear that he may be dead.
zh: 他们担心他可能已经死了。

en: He has been dead for five years.
He avenged his dead father.
zh: 他为死去的父亲报了仇。

en: He cherished the memory of his dead wife.
zh: 他一直怀念他死去的妻子。

en: The old couple gave him up for lost.
zh: 老两口觉得他肯定回不来了。

en: He was given up for dead.
He is as good as dead.
He is said to be dead.
He didn't fear death.
He was at the gate of death.
zh: 他当时就在鬼门关门口。

en: He amassed a large fortune before he died.
zh: 他在去世前攒了一大笔钱。

en: On his deathbed he asked me to continue writing to you.
zh: 他在临终前嘱咐我继续给你写信。

en: He remained single till the end of his day.
He was in prison for life.
He kept his sense of humor until the day he died.
zh: 直到去世前，他都保持着幽默感。

en: He is afraid of death.
He is afraid that he will die.
Will he die?
He has one foot in the grave.
He was nearing his end.
He is on the point of death.
He signaled them to stop.
He started at the bank in the post of manager.
He hated to play ball with his manager, so he quit his job.
zh: 他讨厌和经理配合，所以辞职了。

en: He calculated the expenses.
He said that he must see the manager.
He rose to speak in answer to his name.
zh: 听到叫他的名字，他站起来发言。

en: He has a capacity for leadership.
He had all the attributes of a leader.
zh: 他具备领袖该有的一切特质。

en: He is looked up to by all as their leader.
He isn't worthy to take the lead.
He could learn without instruction.
He blew on his fingertips.
He raised a finger in protest.
zh: 他举起一根手指表示抗议。

en: He blew on his fingers to make them warm.
He is lost in thought.
He lost himself in thought.
He laughed in spite of himself.
He came home earlier than I expected.
zh: 他回来的比我想象的早。

en: He is an abler man than I thought.
He was enjoying himself to his heart's content.
He expressed himself clearly.
He dared to propose to her.
He screwed up his courage and proposed to her.
It appears that he is mistaken.
He turned his thoughts toward home.
He is a considerate father.
He is a master at getting his own way.
zh: 他很擅长按自己的心意办事。

en: Did he dare to jump the brook?
He dare not express his opinion.
zh: 他不敢表达自己的意见。

en: He was deprived of his civil rights.
He will run for mayor.
He served as mayor.
He represented the mayor at a ceremony.
zh: 他代表市长出席了仪式。

en: He is going to run for mayor.
They say that he will run for mayor.
He is one of the candidates running for mayor.
He addressed himself to the mayor.
He was elected mayor.
He was sworn in as mayor.
He was elected mayor again.
He was re-elected mayor.
He is acquainted with the mayor.
He shook hands with the mayor.
He exposed corruption in the city government.
zh: 他揭露了市政府的腐败。

en: He breeds cattle for market.
He has his office in town.
He lives in the southern part of the city.
Is he familiar with this part of the city?
He has a bookstore in the center of the city.
zh: 他在市中心开了家书店。

en: He made the children laugh.
He took pains educating his children.
zh: 他在教育孩子上费了不少心思。

en: He warned the children against playing in the street.
zh: 他告诫孩子们不要在马路上玩。

en: He did what he could for his children.
zh: 为了孩子，他能做的都做了。

en: He was severe with his children.
He sat there surrounded by his children.
zh: 他坐在那儿，孩子们围在他身边。

en: He brought back his child in his car.
zh: 他开车把孩子接回来了。

en: He worked hard to make his child happy.
zh: 为了让孩子高兴，他干活儿挺拼的。

en: He was strict in disciplining his children.
He was delicate as a child.
He's been delicate since he was a boy.
He was always watching TV when he was a child.
He took great pains in educating his children.
zh: 他为了教育孩子操碎了心。

en: He doesn't know how to handle children.
zh: 他不知道怎么跟孩子打交道。

en: He is good at dealing with children.
He objects to being treated like a child.
zh: 他反对别人把他当小孩看。

en: He lost his eyesight when he was still a child.
zh: 他还是个孩子的时候就失明了。

en: When he was a child, he would go fishing on Sundays.
zh: 他小时候周日经常去钓鱼。

en: He used to haunt those caves as a little boy.
zh: 他小时候经常在那些洞穴里转悠。

en: He may often have been here when he was a child.
zh: 他小时候可能经常来这儿。

en: He quarreled with his wife about their children.
zh: 他因为孩子的事跟老婆吵了一架。

en: He is in anguish over her child.
zh: 他正为她的孩子感到苦恼。

en: He left an immense fortune to his children.
zh: 他给孩子留了一大笔遗产。

en: He has no authority over his own children.
zh: 他在自己孩子面前一点威信都没有。

en: He is a brute to his children.
zh: 他对孩子简直太残忍了。

en: Child as he was, he worked hard to help his mother.
zh: 虽说是个孩子，他还是拼命帮他妈妈干活。

en: Even though he was a child, he worked hard to help his mother.
zh: 尽管当时还小，他还是努力帮妈妈干活。

en: Even though he's a child, he can understand her story.
zh: 别看他是个孩子，他能听懂她的故事。

en: Child as he was, he made up his mind to do the work for himself.
zh: 他虽说是个孩子，但也下定决心要独立完成这项工作。

en: Though he was a child, he made up his mind to do the work himself.
zh: 虽然还是个孩子，他已经决定自己干了。

en: He does not take care of his children.
He doesn't take care of his children.
He always pays attention to his children's behavior.
zh: 他总是关注着孩子的一举一动。

en: He did everything he could do for the sake of his children.
zh: 为了孩子，他已经尽了全力。

en: He was the idol of children.
He gave his children a good education.
zh: 他给孩子提供了良好的教育。

en: He denies nothing to his children.
zh: 他对孩子向来是百依百顺。

en: He told his children not to make so much noise.
He told the children about his adventures in Africa.
zh: 他给孩子们讲了他在非洲冒险的故事。

en: He watched the boys swimming.
zh: 他看着那些男孩子游泳。

en: He watched after the children as they were swimming.
zh: 孩子们游泳的时候，他在旁边照看着。

en: Though only a child, he was interested in reading books on philosophy.
zh: 虽然只是个孩子，他却对哲学书很感兴趣。

en: He will not permit his children to sit up late.
He doesn't know the cares of raising children.
zh: 他不知道养孩子有多不容易。

en: He works all the harder because his baby was born.
zh: 因为孩子出生了，他干活儿更有劲头了。

en: He excelled in music even as a child.
zh: 他从小就在音乐方面很有天赋。

en: He has a good deal of intelligence for a child.
zh: 对一个孩子来说，他挺聪明的。

en: He has a great deal of intelligence for a child.
zh: 作为一个孩子，他真的非常聪明。

en: He got his sister to help him paint his room.
zh: 他让他姐姐帮他刷房间。

en: He had his older sister help him paint the wall of his room.
zh: 他让他姐姐帮忙粉刷房间的墙壁。

en: He felt great affection for his sister.
